intro: Carlowrightia californica, commonly known as the California fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its nectar-rich flowers attract hummingbirds and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance.
